description: A trust provider is a third-party entity that creates, maintains, and manages identity information for users and devices. When an application request is made, the identity information sent by the trust provider is evaluated by Verified Access before allowing or denying the application request.

parameters.name: OidcOptions
parameters.description: The options for a OpenID Connect-compatible user-identity trust provider. This parameter is required when the provider type is user. Issuer (string) --- The OIDC issuer. AuthorizationEndpoint (string) --- The OIDC authorization endpoint. TokenEndpoint (string) --- The OIDC token endpoint. UserInfoEndpoint (string) --- The OIDC user info endpoint. ClientId (string) --- The client identifier. ClientSecret (string) --- The client secret. Scope (string) --- OpenID Connect (OIDC) scopes are used by an application during authentication to authorize access to a user's details. Each scope returns a specific set of user attributes.

nested_params.name: Issuer
nested_params.description: The OIDC issuer.

nested_params.name: AuthorizationEndpoint
nested_params.description: The OIDC authorization endpoint.

nested_params.name: TokenEndpoint
nested_params.description: The OIDC token endpoint.

nested_params.name: UserInfoEndpoint
nested_params.description: The OIDC user info endpoint.

nested_params.name: ClientId
nested_params.description: The client identifier.

nested_params.name: ClientSecret
nested_params.description: The client secret.

nested_params.name: Scope
nested_params.description: OpenID Connect (OIDC) scopes are used by an application during authentication to authorize access to a user's details. Each scope returns a specific set of user attributes.

parameters.name: DeviceOptions
parameters.description: The options for a device-based trust provider. This parameter is required when the provider type is device. TenantId (string) --- The ID of the tenant application with the device-identity provider. PublicSigningKeyUrl (string) --- The URL Amazon Web Services Verified Access will use to verify the authenticity of the device tokens.

nested_params.name: TenantId
nested_params.description: The ID of the tenant application with the device-identity provider.

nested_params.name: PublicSigningKeyUrl
nested_params.description: The URL Amazon Web Services Verified Access will use to verify the authenticity of the device tokens.

parameters.name: PolicyReferenceName
parameters.description: The identifier to be used when working with policy rules.

parameters.name: TagSpecifications
parameters.description: The tags to assign to the Verified Access trust provider. (dict) --- The tags to apply to a resource when the resource is being created. When you specify a tag, you must specify the resource type to tag, otherwise the request will fail. ResourceType (string) --- The type of resource to tag on creation. Tags (list) --- The tags to apply to the resource. (dict) --- Describes a tag. Key (string) --- The key of the tag. Constraints: Tag keys are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 127 Unicode characters. May not begin with aws:. Value (string) --- The value of the tag. Constraints: Tag values are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 256 Unicode characters.

nested_params.name: ResourceType
nested_params.description: The type of resource to tag on creation.

nested_params.name: Tags
nested_params.description: The tags to apply to the resource.

nested_params.name: Key
nested_params.description: The key of the tag. Constraints: Tag keys are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 127 Unicode characters. May not begin with aws:.

nested_params.name: Value
nested_params.description: The value of the tag. Constraints: Tag values are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 256 Unicode characters.

parameters.name: ClientToken
parameters.description: A unique, case-sensitive token that you provide to ensure idempotency of your modification request. For more information, see Ensuring idempotency. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

parameters.name: SseSpecification
parameters.description: The options for server side encryption. CustomerManagedKeyEnabled (boolean) --- Enable or disable the use of customer managed KMS keys for server side encryption. Valid values: True | False KmsKeyArn (string) --- The ARN of the KMS key.

nested_params.name: CustomerManagedKeyEnabled
nested_params.description: Enable or disable the use of customer managed KMS keys for server side encryption. Valid values: True | False.

nested_params.name: KmsKeyArn
nested_params.description: The ARN of the KMS key.

parameters.name: NativeApplicationOidcOptions
parameters.description: The OpenID Connect (OIDC) options. PublicSigningKeyEndpoint (string) --- The public signing key endpoint. Issuer (string) --- The OIDC issuer identifier of the IdP. AuthorizationEndpoint (string) --- The authorization endpoint of the IdP. TokenEndpoint (string) --- The token endpoint of the IdP. UserInfoEndpoint (string) --- The user info endpoint of the IdP. ClientId (string) --- The OAuth 2.0 client identifier. ClientSecret (string) --- The OAuth 2.0 client secret. Scope (string) --- The set of user claims to be requested from the IdP.

nested_params.description: The public signing key endpoint.

nested_params.description: The OIDC issuer identifier of the IdP.

nested_params.description: The authorization endpoint of the IdP.

nested_params.description: The token endpoint of the IdP.

nested_params.description: The user info endpoint of the IdP.

nested_params.name: ClientSecret
nested_params.description: The OAuth 2.0 client secret.

nested_params.name: Scope
nested_params.description: The set of user claims to be requested from the IdP.
